intro: Macrostylis villosa subsp. minor, commonly known as the hairy macrostylis, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its shorter stature and more densely hairy stems compared to the typical form. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
